Published 2012 Jul 4. doi:10.3389/fimmu.2012.00185 Complement -Innate Immune System Complement The complement system is very handily named as it does exactly as it says - it works alongside the immune system to help give it a boost. It consists of about 20 serum protein, the most important of which are: 1.C3aandC5afor recruiting phagocytes (chemo attractants) 2.C3bandC4bwhich are opsonins(makes antigen tasty) 3.C5-C9is responsible for helping to kill pathogens - these form the "membrane attack complex", which come together to form a pore (hole) in the cellular membrane of bacteria.
